website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy lap desk with an innovative design that might just help kiddos sit still and focus on the task at hand.
pros: Integrated desk and seat can be used virtually anywhere
Relies on body weight to stay upright, effectively encouraging kids to sit still
Desk surface is angled to promote proper posture
Sturdy construction can take a beating
cons: The seat isn't the most comfortable, but a cushion is available for separate purchase

customer_reviews.title: Great or flexible seating!!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing for flexible seating in my classroom. They are very durable and withstood the beating of 5th graders!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get this sooner?
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I wish we had these when I was in school!! This is the best idea ever made. I thought that maybe the height of the desk would not be enough for my teenage daughter, but it's just right. She studies in her room, on the floor, even when she has a desk in our loft. With this, she can use on the floor, in bed, on the couch....outside. The plastic is a one-piece, solid construction. I'm hoping it will last forever =)
customer_reviews.author: Renee M. Gorischek

customer_reviews.title: Great in concept
customer_reviews.text: Great in concept! It would be helpful if the bottom was heavier so it wouldn't tip over on its own, but I can live with it. My 4th grade students love sitting on the floor, and this is a bit easier for some of them to use, rather than a traditional lap desk. Storage with it will be difficult, but I am working on it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pemberton

customer_reviews.title: Great value and the help you didn't know you needed.
customer_reviews.text: I love this desk. It is handy for when I want to take notes at a webinar. In the past, I had to juggle my notebook in my lab as my computer table didn't have enough room. This is great and solves a huge problem. It is easy to store and works with my office chair.
customer_reviews.author: Robin A Woodell

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and awkward
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 7 and she kept putting things on it expecting it to stay when she’d get up... not practical for younger kids. Plus it’s bulky. We returned ours...
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Star

customer_reviews.title: alllmost perfect
customer_reviews.text: if you like sitting on the floor, this is for you! it’s not the most comfortable, but i purchased some donut seat cushions that work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: katharine spenta

customer_reviews.title: Awesome flexible seating!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my flexible seating classroom. My kiddos love it! I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids
customer_reviews.text: Do you also struggle with ADHD and focusing? Are you also a weirdo who sits on the floor? ME TOO. This floor desk is the perfect solution to late night paperwork when desks are just too constraining. It's at the perfect height for typing, even as a full grown adult. Not just for elementary kids.
customer_reviews.author: Casey R

customer_reviews.title: Homeschooler must have!
customer_reviews.text: We are a homeschooling family, and despite owning traditional desks and a full table, my kids gravitate towards the floor for activities and reading. They were always hunched over and in awkward positions, until I found this amazing desk. Now they fit perfectly and are actually using better posture. We can school outside, inside or anywhere we like. These are small enough to stack in a closet, and toss in the trunk, but sturdy enough to endure my 4 year old’s play. They accommodate every size! I am 5’9 and used it comfortably. I can not recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Logan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy LITTLE anywhere desk.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an adult female just under 5' tall and I hoped that this would make a good laptop desk. The description is pretty clear that it's for kids, but in the video they featured some older children who were at least as tall as I am using it for a laptop. It works, but it would be so much better if it came in an adult size. The small size makes it uncomfortable to use for longer than an hour. I wouldn't recommend this for anyone over 4' tall.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The kids like them but they are very hard and they can't use them for very long!
customer_reviews.author: tim latta

customer_reviews.title: Easy extra seating for students, strength could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The overall comfort for children is good, and it seems as if it will last. I have only had it less than a month though, so hard to say. It will be ok to use for elementary age students, but the desk part does bend a little if they lean on it. Also, they have to take their work off the desktop before getting up or it will all tip off with the desk. That is not a flaw, just something to be aware of. It could be a teaching opportunity for them actually to clean up before leaving your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Zannah

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 (1 for each kid) and they've been super helpful for quarantine. Like others have said, it took a couple days for the kids (9 & 6) to learn that they can't leave things on the desk and stand-up without the desk tipping over, but otherwise, they love them. They use them all day long, not just for school work. They're easy to put away if we don't want them out (but we use them constantly! If I had one complaint, it would be that I can't seem to find the cushions that they make to go with it online anywhere--we've adapted and use things from around the house, but I would love to get the cushions.
customer_reviews.author: JChet

customer_reviews.title: It's not just for kids anymore
customer_reviews.text: I'm so very happy with this purchase. I know that this is marketed as a kid's product. But I ordered this for me. I am a 43 year old woman. Because of the recent global epidemic now, I work from home with a laptop. I didn't want the laptop directly on my body. I wanted the ability to work outside while sitting in the grass if I want it in a chair in front of the TV if I want. This product gives me that flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: 1stNoel

customer_reviews.title: The most important fact
customer_reviews.text: I received the item and it well packaged, but it has signs of being a returned item as it has many scaffolds on the desk part, I resent the fact that I’m paying the price of a new item and it very clearly to have used, it was a gift for a grand child, that now regretting buying.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: These are great for on the go or around the house.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these for their school work. We usually went into the kitchen table to do our school work and now they can do it anywhere. Took them awhile to figure out how to keep their books from falling off when getting up but soon found that if you put sit next to the couch not only will it hook the end under the couch but give you something to lean on. Great product, sturdy plastic!
customer_reviews.author: RanchWife06

customer_reviews.title: Design needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy it again. The item is not collapsable, so it is not easy to store. It takes up a good bit of room when not in use, it topples over when not being used. The table top part of the desk is not straight, so you can't set a beverage or a small plate on it. Not ideal for a tablet due to the angle. Our child has used it once, not a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Hustad

customer_reviews.title: Decent little desk
customer_reviews.text: This desk is pretty good. I bought it for my son to use during home isolation school because he felt like his sisters were distracting him. This way he could work wherever he wanted. I don't know if it's something we would use all the time if we were homeschooling or something like that, but as an occasional surface to be used in odd places (like sitting on the floor), it's decent enough. He has used it to do origami while watching TV since school got out. It's a decent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daughter's Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had this on her wish list so I purchased it for her for Christmas. She likes to use her laptop while sitting on the floor backed up to the radiator during the winter. She really likes it. She does wish there was a little padding around the base. She thinks that would make it more comfortable, but said she is very happy with it. I think we will find something to lay around the base and then it will be perfect for her.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Ann Schmearer

customer_reviews.title: this is cool
customer_reviews.text: I do wish it collapsed so that it stored away when not in use. Darn thing hurts to bang your shin on. But its usefull and the kids enjoyed it. I would love one that has a larger surface, this is the size of a small laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: 4th graders love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for flexible seating in my 4th grade classroom. They love it. I love that it's super sturdy and no matter the abuse, it seems to stand up to the task. I really thought it would have been bent or broken by use of kids bigger than the "model" in the picture, but it's sturdy. I'm going to order more!!!
customer_reviews.author: VLD13

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Sitting on the bottom part, it puts the little desk in a very comfortable position to work--even for an adult (5'4") I use it in passenger vans on long trips where I need to continue working, but don't have the space for a lap desk. It's also not as cumbersome to carry around as you'd think.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 2nd/3rd grade classroom through a Donors Choose project. I have enough for half of my class to use at the carpet when they meet with me. They work great! They can do pencil and paper work as well as chromebook work with me very easily. They can even be used by adults in a chair, so I know I will use them in many classes to come.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen S.

customer_reviews.title: great for homeschool
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a supplemental desk for our 6-yr.-old homeschooler. We use it for handwriting activities when he needs to be able to sit directly facing the white board in our school room. I was worried that it would be sized too big for him so we might have to wait to use it till a later year, but it's perfect for him! He's a pretty average-to-slightly-small-sized 6-yr.-old. Seems very sturdy/indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: LouiseTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Seat needs more weight
customer_reviews.text: The seat needs a little more weight in it to balance it all out. Everytime my 6 year old gets up, she has to first remember to remove her school work or laptop, otherwise as soon as she stands up it tips over. It's very annoying and now my kid refuses to use it, collecting dust. It's a great concept but they need to figure out this major design flaw, I'll be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my classroom!
customer_reviews.text: I teach second grade and am always looking for alternative seating options. I ordered two of these to try them out. We just finished the first week of school and there are already arguments over who gets to them first. I often find myself sitting on the floor to work with small groups so I even tried one out myself... I will be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: Anne M Russo

customer_reviews.title: impressed
customer_reviews.text: my middle school students love these. they use them in their chairs, on the floor, on milk crates... all over! They are sturdy and well built and comfortable, even for 12 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas T. Von Hoene

customer_reviews.title: Their Favorite Seat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for my 3rd grade classroom. My students love to sit around the room to work. When using a laptop though they are limited on where they can sit. I found this and thought I’d give one a try. They LOVE it. Very study. They talk about how comfortable and are so excited they can have options to do their laptop work in the classroom. Definitely purchasing more when the school year starts in the Fall.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect way to make a desk in any room on multi surfaces. You can sit in a chair and use this. On the couch. On the floor. Backyard on the stairs of our deck. The stairs of the front porch. Love this! I bought this for my kids to use as a back up during virtual learning in case we don’t have space on a table. Perfect idea
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Really durable
customer_reviews.text: The material is a much sturdier, better looking plastic than I imagined. They are great for flexible seating options in my second grade classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Sunita

customer_reviews.title: Most coveted seat in the room
customer_reviews.text: What happens when teachers expand the types of seating for students? Kids empowered to choose their learning spots for the day is what happens. These desks can be used anywhere in the classroom, from floor to chair, without taking up more room. They are durable, easy to wipe down, and stackable. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: missmc2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kindergartner and first grader!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE their new "desks"! They use them when writing, coloring, or using their iPads. The desks are sturdy yet lightweight enough for the kids to move them wherever they want. With kids being at home and learning virtually due to COVID-19, these desks help avoid the monotony of always sitting at the dining room table to do schoolwork. Its like having a flexible seating classroom right in our living room - or wherever else we choose to take them! The only reason why I didn't give this 5 stars is because I wish they came with seat cushions. I find it a bit unreasonable to charge an extra $15 for the cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for my 7 yr. old as an option vs. the dining table for schoolwork. I am disappointed , it does not stand on its own. If he is not being aware, everything is on the floor when he gets up. We are going to go ahead and keep it for when he wants to sit and play on his tablet but even at his age he calls it "dumb and useless."
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Students love them!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for flexible seating in my second grade class and my students rushed to them! They're great at making students sit up when typing and they can be used anywhere for students to work independently or to form their own groups. No regrets here! Just wish they could make a mark proof version for my artist students....
customer_reviews.author: KLucci

customer_reviews.title: My students LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: I work with students of all abilities. I've found this to be very useful for students who just don't sit in seats very well but prefer to work on the floor. This gives them a workspace. Students like to also use these in chairs and left-handed students like these to help with space since most desks are for right-handed people. I've had mine for over a year now and because of the demand for them from students, I plan to get more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for creating a learning space!
customer_reviews.text: These little desks are awesome. It's true that they work for ALL ages. I've used them, I'm 5'4. I use them for home schooling with my 3 year old and 1 year old. The ONLY thing is the kids don't get the concept of not leaning forward. This issue was easily solved by keeping something right under that they can lean on. Sometimes for my 1 year old, I sit right next to him... And kind of use my weight to hold down his seat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed by this little desk! I think my students will love it. It's big enough that, as an adult, I can use it, but it's small enough, my 5 year old can also use it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Oh my, this is exactly what I was looking for. I've tried all types of lap desks, I don't like the ones with pillows as my lap gets too hot, the ones with legs don't fit well in my chair. This desk will work on the floor, at the beach, on the sofa or in my easy chair. Good price too. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hartt

customer_reviews.title: middle school kids LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This has been officially called, "DOPE" multiple times. Kids sit anywhere, even the hallway and they love it. Some use stadium seats and this together and it makes a portable make-shift desk, its so neat! 6-8th grade approved. I bought 4 and was apprehensive about whether older kids would generally like these, but they really do.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Cocagne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all ages and multi functional
customer_reviews.text: These required no assembly! My 3 year old twins and my 185 lb 35 year old husband were able to sit comfortably using this. It's thin but durable so storing it is easy. This has been perfect for distance learning, especially with young children.
customer_reviews.author: ike v

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to store.
customer_reviews.text: This absolutely does work. My 5 year old, and myself can both use it. I’m giving it four stars because it is awkward to store when not in use. It does not fold up, and it tips over when it’s not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller people!
customer_reviews.text: I knew it would be a stretch, but I bought this as a 6'2" person because I end up working on the floor a lot with my laptop next to my kids. It does the job, but when my kids use it, it definitely shines.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Super useful for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: These are the GREATEST invention....bought 3 for my 3 grandkids and I love them so much I am going to purchase one for myself! I tried it out by just sitting on it on the couch and it's a great TV tray or lap desk!
customer_reviews.author: Its•me•KT

customer_reviews.title: Withstands Middle Schoolers for A Full Year!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these and so do my students. So much so that they even want to use them when they are sitting in a chair or on a bench! I really wish there were 3 or 5 packs because I can't afford a 10-pack. I only have 2 black ones so far and the kids vy for them. They are a bit awkward to store when you only have a few, but they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne31381

customer_reviews.title: Good but top heavy
customer_reviews.text: So... It is as described and works well with my laptop. I got this so my 9 yr old could do her school work on the laptop. So far no issues. She does say that the seat or bottom gets uncomfortable after a while. I used it once and had no problems or issues which is nice since I am a heavier set woman. I will say to make sure you take your computer off first if you are going to stand because these do not stay upright once you get off. The bottom and top are not proportionate and the entire structure is top heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jsikah

customer_reviews.title: Let's my daughter work anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to move from one room to another. The only issue I have is that it doesn't stand up on its own and therefore has to be leaned up against something whenever it is not in use. Also, you cannot get up and leave things on the desk because it will fall over and spill everything on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy McCargo

customer_reviews.title: Cute desks!
customer_reviews.text: Well one desk came cracked. Like two pieces broken off and in the box. I don't know what happened, maybe shipping? Idk how these desks can even crack! They seem to be very durable. My daughter loved the other one and I ordered a cushion for it that fits perfectly! Disappointed about one happy about the other.
customer_reviews.author: Beto&Rayos

customer_reviews.title: Kindergarten teacher
customer_reviews.text: I got this with my school money and my kids / class loved it. I wish I had more $ to get more than just one because we do carpet work together all the time and they love it! We now pick a carpet "rockstar" that gets to use all week. (rockstar being one that listens and pays attention the best that week) ! Would buy more!! Very cute!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. Even though our kids have desks in their playroom, they often like to draw before they go to sleep at night. They can easily move where they want to set up shop as these are lightweight and portable. Love the set up and very easy to clean. Wish we had found these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: m&m

customer_reviews.title: Fun desk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after we decided to do virtual learning this year. He loves that he came move around with it and do his work anywhere in the house. He likes playing with his toys on it and coloring. It’s the perfect height for my kindergartner. He thinks it’s comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Saraht1715

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use floor desk
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool little desk. My 7 yr old loves it to sit & do homework or just play on his tablet or have a snack. At first it's a little awkward to sit in it, but after a few times and figuring out a good way to enter it becomes much easier to use. Very sturdy. I don't know a weight limit but I even sat in it to try it.
customer_reviews.author: corey brown

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Seating Superstar Product
customer_reviews.text: These are AMAZING and my lil artists love using them in the art room for some flexible seating options. They are super durable and teach the kids to sit cross cross to hold the bottom under them. I love the array of colors to choose from and just wish they made a storage rack for ten vs the thirty. I have eight in total and would love to keep them organized in my art room.
customer_reviews.author: artnteacher

customer_reviews.title: My 6th graders like these a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I got these as part of a Donors Choose project and my kids really enjoy working on these floor seats. At first I wasn't sure if they would work for 6th graders but they are popular and give kids an alternative to a standard desk. They seem very durable. I would order more without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Anneliese

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay for ages 4-6
customer_reviews.text: This is okay for small kids but older children cannot use this well. The table top tends to bend downward as they try to do their work. It was worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Don't stand up with things on it!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would change is that it needs to sit up on its own. Every time my daughter gets up, everything topples over! I have to put the ottoman on the back end of it so it doesn't fall forward. It's very sturdy, and she finds it to be quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Overbay

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for classroom flexible seating
customer_reviews.text: These seem pretty price-friendly. Bought for my kid’s 2nd grade classroom. Teacher seemed happy with them. Kids seemed to like them. Agree that any larger kid than 2-3rd grade would probably be too big for these. My 5 year old tried it out and thought it was cool. It was awkward as an adult.
customer_reviews.author: CrafyK

customer_reviews.title: My students love these...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these are great. They stack up easily and can be stored in a corner or against the wall. Other then my students legs falling to sleep from keeping them folded, they have not complained (they have learned to stretch their legs to avoid legs sleeping).
customer_reviews.author: Praiz420

customer_reviews.title: Hard for my third graders to use. Students had ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard for my third graders to use. Students had difficulty getting seated correctly so desks didn’t fall over. Could work for older students.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids as they like to do their school work on the floor in the living room. They work great and perfect for doing their online school work during quarantine period. It would be perfect if it folded for easier storage.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Probably best for kids or small adults
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and bought this to try at home. It's ok, but doesn't work great for me as it's a little small. However, I think it will work well for some of my students and am looking forward to getting a few when we're able to be in the classroom again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: Fun seating option for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: My students enjoy using them as a seating option on the carpet. However they only stay up when a student is sitting on them. I have had a few laptops fell hard to the floor where a student just got up without moving the computer first. We have only been using them for a month but they seem to be holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: 🙄☹😖 nope
customer_reviews.text: Nope my 6 year old is just too small forward on us because when she sits on it it kind of leans forward it doesn't sit up straight like she can't write on a piece of paper while on it it was a waste of my money
customer_reviews.author: Photo_Now

customer_reviews.title: great for the ground
customer_reviews.text: It's great for using on the ground but as soon as you get up it flips forward and all the papers will fall off so careful. its sturdy my 11 year is using it. he really likes it. a fun way to do school work.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Flexible seating option
customer_reviews.text: I like this seat for flexible seating option in their classroom. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that I don't like that the desk is textured, which will make it very difficult for children to write on.
customer_reviews.author: claire gardner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson and thinking about buying one for me. Works as started.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Savoy-Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. Got a green and pink one to my kids and they love them. Currently waiting for the cushions to become available as by themselves, they can be uncomfortable if sitting for long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Need adjustments.
customer_reviews.text: I love these, comes in handy for homework & lessons. The only down fall is that it's not as strudy as I would like. Over time the desks starts to lean forward and I can see my girls reaching or slouching while using it. Also the desk should be maybe 2-3 inches longer (up and down) not side to side. At least an inch longer than a 8x11 paper.
customer_reviews.author: Vuevang

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the classroom
customer_reviews.text: My second graders love these portable desks!! Makes completing their work easier.
customer_reviews.author: Barbra

customer_reviews.title: This is someone's vision of a good idea.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a great idea for a young child to use for distance learning. In order for that to happen it needs to be engineered properly. The item doesn't stand on it's own and every time the child moves, the laptop is in jeopardy of falling off. It's a huge piece of useless plastic.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tuccio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: My students fight over these! They’re 10-13 and they all love them. I have bought three so far! It is hard for an adult to get up off the floor from them, but that could be more of an age problem and not a product issue 😂
customer_reviews.author: Addy's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t know how much we needed this
customer_reviews.text: My elementary age daughter has much better posture on a laptop with this desk than she did just on the floor. Very happy with the purchase. I think she’d like a seat cushion, but she will always choose this over a real desk and chair.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for my 3 & 7 yr olds - they love them! We've added small, home-made cushions. I've used it too. Parents keep in mind the top is slightly tilted for writing posture; so dishware will slip. Also, they do not stand alone, clear the top before you stand.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Cron

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fuctional
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quickly, very functional and easy to use. Though I bought this for my 8 yr old grandson, I may consider buying a classroom set for my high school students when doing outside activities.
customer_reviews.author: Angela J Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this desk and I use it often, but it’s not very sturdy. It feels like it could snap at any moment and since it doesn’t fold it’s kind of hard to store. Overall it’s a decent product and worth the relatively cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good idea
customer_reviews.text: Its a good idea but you cant really put more than 1 thing at a time on it, if my boys need to use their chrome and school book they cant, just enough space for 1 thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ching Saetern

customer_reviews.title: Kids in the Class Really Enjoy Sitting on These..
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 4th grade teacher and we use a lot of adaptive seating. Our students really enjoyed being able to sit on these when we did work on the rug. The desk portion is great because it allows students something to lean on while they write.
customer_reviews.author: Amazombie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for classroom use!
customer_reviews.text: Got a few of these for my classroom, my students love them. They really help keep students from looking down at their screen and give them their own space. They do scratch quite easily, just from the bottom of their computers, but they still work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rance

customer_reviews.title: Great for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: This pretty awesome. Both of my sons. (21 and 15) said it’s the perfect height and they are tall so I imagine that middle schoolers will be fine. I always have students who would rather sit on the floor. So this is perfect
customer_reviews.author: maryleeteach

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My students absolutely love these lap tables! I can't wait to get a full class set. They recognize what a privilege it is to have a fun, alternative way to read and do activities in the classroom :)
customer_reviews.author: Kaleigh15

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my third grader to have some flexibility in her work space during remote learning. She likes it but still mostly sits at her desk or the dining table. But my 8th and 9th graders use it all the time and even I occasionally borrow it to sit outside with my laptop. It fits us all comfortably. It’s sturdy, stable and comfortable. I am debating whether to buy one or two more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used by students each day
customer_reviews.text: My students love these desks. They're able to place their math binders on the desk surface. They are comfortable and utilized daily. The color looks great in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mom

customer_reviews.title: What Did I Do Without These?!
customer_reviews.text: My students LOVE these! They are great for iPads, reading, writing, etc. Everyone that comes into my classroom asks where I got them. I cannot suggest these enough for every teacher and parent!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: It's Plastic
customer_reviews.text: I got this to check out to see if I wanted to use them in my Kindergarten classroom. I do like the design and think it will work well for kinder students. Some things I didn't realize was that it is plastic - thin plastic. It cannot stand up by itself. When my daughter got off of it , it fell forward. I worry about this with students sitting on it and storing it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Liddon

customer_reviews.title: Students love’em!
customer_reviews.text: My students love these so much. My 8th graders use them daily and love the flexible seating options. I call them surfboards. Chrome books sit on the perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Small and not convenient to focus on the actual work
customer_reviews.text: Desk size is very small and so much coordination required to balance. Not easy to use. I have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal_techie

customer_reviews.title: Great desk/seating alternative
customer_reviews.text: My students absolutely love this! They actually argued over it on the first day to see who could use it. Working on getting more for the classroom as it is great for computer use or as a lap or floor desk!
customer_reviews.author: Gail Gultz

customer_reviews.title: They are durable and unique
customer_reviews.text: Fifth graders have loved them! They are a bit small for this age but they think they are so awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Good for lower grades
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids who want to sit on floor and read or write. Not recommended for computer use. If the student forgets to remove computer before getting up it falls to floor. 2 cracked screens in my class from it.
customer_reviews.author: JulieP

customer_reviews.title: My Students LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for flexible seating while writing or using the iPad or laptop. My students LOVE these. I bought 6 for my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: MaryD - PA

customer_reviews.title: Happy Son!
customer_reviews.text: My son (8 years old) likes the desk so much that he even use it in his bed. 😁 🌟 Indeed a big help to us especially now that he is doing an online class.
customer_reviews.author: Yel Palma Ortega

customer_reviews.title: What a great invention!
customer_reviews.text: My students absolutely adore these! I wish I had one for each child. They allow for flexible seating and make learning fun when working on an assignment or using technology. Great for my second graders!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Koenig

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this! My 7 yr old is now able to do his homework in peace. It’s real good for small spaces where u can’t have a desk. I highly recommend,it’s easy to store in a closet or just anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: irene castillo

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: My fourth graders are obsessed with these. They are wonderful for individual and group work in a flexible seating classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kyri

customer_reviews.title: Loved by students!
customer_reviews.text: My students love these to complete work at, read and work on Chromebooks. These are great for flexible seating. These are very durable and fit together for storing.
customer_reviews.author: Lv2read

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Great for my 5 & 7 year olds! They use for books & chromebooks. The only downside is that it tips when they get up...so that took getting used to for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short Uses - Great Seat
customer_reviews.text: My students like these for SHORT periods of use. The plastic seat is HARD!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kimsey

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: My students in 3rd grade love these chairs. They are great for students that need to work on their own away from others and the kids love them.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Cool seat
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. My son got it for his Birthday! He had been using it, and likes it very well. Seems very sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. My grandchildren love this and it's exactly what I need for homeschooling while schools are closed during this pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: KimHall

customer_reviews.title: Warning your kid is going to want this back
customer_reviews.text: Small and convenient. Work area is as good as it gets. I would recommend this to me and anyone with the need to type, read or draw.
customer_reviews.author: amazon sympathizer

product_meta.title: ECR4Kids The Surf Storage Rack, Stores 30 Portable Lap Desks for a Flexible Classroom, Desk Cart with Heavy-Duty Rolling and Locking Casters (Surf Desk Sold Separately), Grey (ELR-15800)
product_meta.description: Color:Grey| Size:1-Pack| Style:RackMake your classroom, office or library mobile ready with the Surf Storage Rack. Designed to hold 30 units of the Surf, the innovative portable desk design from ECR4Kids. Portable work surfaces are ideal for flexible classrooms and alternative learning environments. Cart is constructed with sturdy, powder coated metal and features four heavy-duty locking casters, to make it easy to move from room to room. This functional storage cart is the perfect height for children ages 6 years and up to independently grab their own desk and then easily stack them when learning time is over. Operation of cart is recommended for ages 15 years and older. Easily clean by simply wiping down with a mild soap and warm water solution and dry thoroughly. The ECR4Kids Surf Desk and Storage Cart is GREENGUARD [GOLD] Certified for healthier indoor air, CPSIA lead and phthalate compliant and features rounded edges for added safety. Storage cart measures 19.5" L x 16.9" W x 54.8" H and requires adult assembly.
feature_bullets: SURF STORAGE RACK: Metal rolling cart is designed to hold 30 units of the Surf, the innovative portable desk design by ECR4Kids; Surf’s sold separately
CLASSROOM FRIENDLY: Functional storage rack encourages children to independently grab their own desk and then easily stack them when learning time is over

FLEXIBLE LEARNING: Create a successful and dynamic classroom environment with portable desks that let you take lessons on the go; cart comes with 4 heavy-duty locking casters to allow easy transportation from room to room
COMPLETE THE SET: Create a collaborative learning space and pair with The Surf Portable Desk (ELR-15810) and Surf Cushion (ELR-15831); sold separately
CERTIFIED AND SAFE: GREENGUARD [GOLD] Certified for healthier indoor air; CPSIA lead and phthalate compliant; features rounded edges for added safety
PRODUCT DIMENSIONS: Assembled cart measures 19.5" L x 16.9" W x 54.8" H; adult assembly required
